description: Survey of the civilization of Japan from prehistoric times to the present.
name: INTRO TO JAPANESE CIVIL

values.comments:
This course studies the civilization of Japan from prehistoric times to the present. It is an introductory course on Japanese civilization, usually required or recommended for such higher-level courses as EALC263, ‘Topics in Japanese Thought.’
Students described the course to be “very well planned out and balanced in terms of time periods and notable figures.” However, covering such a vast period in only one semester actually limited the course, causing students to feel like they were just “skimming the surface” rather than truly understanding the topics in greater depth. Students commented that the lectures did not contain enough material and that the professor relied more on the readings.
Professor Kano was described as the “greatest” at making Japanese culture and history very comprehensive. Students stated that they enjoyed Professor Kano’s stories for these helped them understand what was going on during each period.
Because the course does not greatly analyze the history of each period, it was recommended for students who have little to no knowledge of Japanese culture. Students further commented that the readings were not too difficult or overwhelming, and allowed them to read and think more about the topics discussed.
